info.title: HQ Master Data API
info.description: API for querying the HQ canonical leads database

get.description: Get leads with optional filters.
Get leads who were recently promoted.
Get leads who recently started a new role.
Get leads at VC portfolio companies.

Get leads who previously worked at specified companies.

Uses PostgreSQL function core.get_leads_by_past_employer() for efficient querying.

Get leads who previously worked at customers of the specified company.

Looks up the company's customers from core.company_customers, then finds
leads who have work history at those customer companies.

Get all filter options from reference tables.

This is the canonical source of truth for frontend dropdowns.
All values come from reference tables, not from querying data.
Get seniority levels from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Seniorities Api Filters Seniorities Get

get.description: Get job functions from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Job Functions Api Filters Job Functions Get

get.description: Get employee ranges from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Employee Ranges Api Filters Employee Ranges Get

get.description: Get industries from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Industries Api Filters Industries Get

get.description: Get signals from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Signals Api Filters Signals Get

get.description: Get business models from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Business Models Api Filters Business Models Get

get.description: Get countries from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Countries Api Filters Countries Get

get.description:
Get tech stack technologies from reference table.
Used for autocomplete in the Technologies filter.

Get normalized job titles from reference table.
Used for autocomplete in the Hiring For filter.

post.description:
Create or update a target client view.

If a view for this domain already exists, it will be updated.
Returns the view with its shareable URL.

get.description:
Get a target client view by its slug.

Frontend uses this to load the saved filters when client visits their URL.

delete.description: Delete a target client view by its slug.

get.description:
Validate a session token.

Pass token in Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
Returns whether session is valid and user_id if so.

Get the current user and their org from session token.

Pass token in Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
Returns user details, org, and role.
List all organizations (admin endpoint).

schema.title: Response List Orgs Api Auth Orgs Get

get.description: Get an organization by slug.

post.description:
Send a magic link to the user's email.

Checks if the email domain is approved before sending.

get.description:
Verify a magic link token and create a session.

Creates user and org if they don't exist.
Get companies with optional filters.
Search companies by name or domain for autocomplete.

Lookup company domain by name.
Returns the best matching domain for a given company name.

Get insights about a company's customers:
- Industries of customer companies
- Job titles of people featured in case studies/testimonials

Simple check: does this company have customer data?
Returns: { "has_customers": true/false, "count": N }

Get customer companies for a given company domain.
Returns enriched customer data including name, domain, industry, employee range, and country.

Get ICP criteria and data for a company.
Returns industries, job titles, countries, employee ranges, value proposition, and customer domains.

Get similar companies for a domain.

First checks the database cache. If no data exists (or refresh=True),
calls the Modal function to fetch from companyenrich.com API.

parameters.name: refresh

schema.description: Force refresh from API even if cached
schema.title: Refresh

parameters.description: Force refresh from API even if cached

get.description:
Get companies using a specific technology.
Searches the PredictLeads tech stack data.

Get companies hiring for a specific job title.
Searches the job postings data by normalized_title.
Get a single company by domain with full details.

Get domains that have customer data but no similar companies data.
These are candidates for enrichment.

post.description:
Process pending domains for similar companies enrichment.

Queries pending domains directly, inserts into queue, triggers processing.
Frontend just specifies batch_size - no need to send domains.

get.description: Get status of a similar companies batch.

delete.description:
Clear items from the queue.
By default leaves 'processing' items alone.
Set include_processing=true to clear stuck processing items too.

get.description: Get overall queue status - pending, processing, done, error counts.

post.description:
Ingest BuiltWith tech stack data for a domain.

Flow:
1. Store raw payload → raw.builtwith_payloads
2. Extract each tech → extracted.company_builtwith
3. Auto-populate → reference.technologies (ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING)
4. Map to core → core.company_technologies

get.description: Get people with optional filters.
Get all available gap analysis recipes.
Get the count of records matching a gap recipe, optionally filtered by country.

get.summary: Get Top Vc Missing Customers Count
get.description:
Get count of companies backed by top 70 VCs that are missing customer data.
Uses reference.top_vcs for the curated list of top VCs.

Get companies backed by top 70 VCs that are missing customer data.
Returns company info along with their VC investors from the top 70 list.
Get the list of top 70 VCs from reference.top_vcs.

Generic count endpoint for any allowed table.
This endpoint must be defined LAST so specific routes take precedence.
